p:
Using the data of four models from the Global Land-Atmosphere Coupling Experiment-Coupled Model Intercomparison Project phase 5 (GLACE-CMIP5)
9 ( Extended Data Table 1), we isolate the changes in global terrestrial NBP ( NBP ( LAND) )due to soil moisture variations from the climatological annual cycle ( NBP ( SMVAR) ) as well as due to longer-term soil moisture trends ( NBP ( SMTREND) ) (see Methods). These experiments allow for the systematic quantification of the effect of moisture across models. For each model, the same sea surface temperatures and radiative forcing agents (based on historical and Representative Concentration Pathway 8.5 (RCP8.5) coupled simulations) are prescribed in all runs. These experiments uniquely allow us to isolate the role of soil moisture dynamics in the climate system. Previous studies have used these experiments to evaluate various aspects of land-atmosphere interactions including enhanced extremes and aridity
9, 13, 14 .
